intro: Sesuvium portulacastrum subsp. portulacastrum, commonly known as seaside purslane, is a halophytic plant adapted to saline environments. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and stems. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, sandy soils, and saline habitats, demonstrating high salt tolerance. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in clusters, and it produces small, rounded fruits. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to stabilize coastal dunes.
